caption: Very convenient convenience store location, somewhat slender, but is now not closed but shut down!!! When will it reopen? Location with non stop client lines. IMPORTANT: ADA compliant subway station.
All I have to say 711 come to upper Harlem we need this around here if you want business.
As an essential worker, I should not be denied service, yet I was, ESPECIALLY over a vagrant that was given service. Re-train your staff
Helpful staff, affordable products, not good quality, but can’t complain on low prices, rare in this neighborhood.

This particular location of 7-Eleven has gone downhill since it was purchased by a franchise owner a few months ago.  All of the friendly staff at night are gone and they are replaced by guys that sigh loudly when you ask for absolutely *anything.* The tall blond guy still has yet to figure out the 7-Eleven Rewards scanner and questions everything the customer says when it comes to sale prices that didn't ring up because he was unable to use the scanner gun correctly to get the rewards number in the register and automatically take off the amounts for the sales prices. My god - the store is the size of a shoebox and he has been there longer than 2 months! How difficult is it to remember a few sale prices?  The microwave was out for over a month, which negates the sales tax, because by NY state law, the food is exempt if it isn't hot (and without the microwave in house, the packaged burritos, sandwiches, etc qualify as exempt.) The customers were told the microwave was broken, but it was still on the counter and one of the customers plugged it in and used it - the cashier got mad about the customer using the "broken" microwave successfully.  I asked tonight about when they stopped serving hot food (pizza, roller foods, etc) because it was 12:30am, and the grills were *clean.* They used to have hot food until about 4am, and then would clean up and change the grills over for breakfast for 6am. The cashier (the blond guy again) said they didn't serve hot food after 11:30pm. I just got pizza there Wednesday night last week around 1am, so I am assuming this is part of the "sigh at everything" mentality when someone asks for something (anything) he doesn't want to deal with. People in the neighborhood all know the blond guy and are pretty vocal about this is why they don't go in 7-Eleven at night - no one wants to deal with him.  EBT payments have been stopped at this location, and the small sign on the door is see-through, so you can't read it. The change was abrupt, and it was embarrassing for the 3 people in front of me who were going to use their EBT to pay for food. The guy behind the counter pointed to the sign in the door that no one could read and said "We do not take EBT. Don't you have some other way to pay?" Poor-shaming at a convenience store that overcharges for everything was a low I never thought I would see from someone in the service industry in NYC in 2019.  The new owner is obviously unconcerned about people frequenting his store, or about giving the customers a good experience and/or quality products anymore. There are two 24 hour grocery stores (Westside Market at Broadway between W.97th and W.98th and Key Foods at W.97th and Amsterdam) plus countless 24 hour delis (like the one almost at the corner of W.96th and Broadway - it is on the south side of W.96th.) The prices are comparable to 7-Eleven, the food is freshly made, when not packaged, and the people working in the deli are professional. Why is this 7-Eleven still in business? Visual connection because it is on Broadway will only get you so far. Skip this store and go to the 24 hour McDonalds between W.96th and W.95th if you want quick, cheap, marginally hot food.

I'm a regular customer at this location on 2567 Broadway store# 35866 between l went to the store to buy a couple of sodas there was a sing 2 liter of Coca-Cola 2 for $3.50 l went to pay at the register and this gentleman his name is Mustak was raising his voice telling me those Coca-Cola are not on sale there is a line behind me he asked the other guy l don't remember his name but he is Asian guy very helpful young man and the other guy Mustak took off the red sing after he saw with his own eyes he was completely wrong it was the most uncomfortable moment on 9-3-2019 exactly @7:45pm if you look at the camera system everything is there you can see by the body language l was very patience now I would think about it twice before l go to that location very embarrassed but at the end he has no choice to sell me the Coca-Cola for the sales price very unprofessional.
Smh 711 one of my favorite store in nyc Nd when go out of town I recently visit this store Nd I felt the clerk was  recist with me it’s very  disoppointing not happy at all
Vagrants are frequently in this store
Good people and the store is clean
This place has a narrow entrance but it is clean and the staff is fast and nice. It's perfect for what you need.

This 7-Eleven at Broadway and 97th Street on the Upper West Side of Manhattan is conveniently close to the subway station at 96th Street. I have bought on numerous occasions a large pizza for about $6.52, including tax.  This shop has all the food items, coffees, sodas, milk, sandwiches, hot dogs, candy and cigarettes you would expect at any other 7-Eleven store.  The staff here are helpful, polite and friendly, and always greet you with a smile.

(Translated by Google) The staff of this 7 eleven is especially friendly. They have an oven and pizzas. The variety of coffees is very wide and they have a great variety of hot and cold drinks.  (Original) El personal de este 7 eleven es especialmente  amable. Disponen de horno y pizzas. La variedad de cafés es muy amplia y tienen gran variedad de bebidas tanto caliente como frías.
